revised_title: Ship Technology in the 1980s: Environmental and Regulatory Aspects
tldr: This article discusses the environmental and regulatory aspects of ship design and operations in the 1980s. It highlights the importance of addressing safety, environmental protection, and commercial viability in the shipping industry. The author explores the impact of international agreements, such as the Safety of Life at Sea (SOLAS) Convention and the Oil Pollution Convention, on ship technology and design. The article also touches upon the need for improved environmental measures, navigational safety, crew competence, and changes in ship structure and equipment.
